title: 5 possible trade targets for Patriots outside of Maxx Crosby, A.J. Brown
author: Conor Roche
bullets: The Patriots may target Colts WR Michael Pittman Jr., who could be a trade candidate due to his $29 million cap hit.
Bears WR DJ Moore, with a potential $24.5 million cap hit, could be an option for the Patriots amidst trade rumors.
Jaguars OL Walker Little, with a $12 million cap hit, might be considered by the Patriots to bolster their offensive line.

title: Jayson Tatum says he still doesn’t have a return date after participating in a 5-on-5 scrimmage at Celtics practice
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Jayson Tatum participated in a five-on-five scrimmage during a Celtics practice but has not set a return date.
Tatum has been practicing with both the Boston Celtics and their G League affiliate, the Maine Celtics, in February.
Celtics coach Joe Mazzulla emphasizes Tatum's full recovery as the priority, with no scheduled return date confirmed yet.

title: NBC Sports broadcast teams rise to the occasion with Olympic calls from Milan Cortina
author: Chad Finn
bullets: NBC broadcasters Kenny Albert and A.J. Mleczko delivered a notable call during Team USA's women's hockey gold medal win.
Terry Gannon, Tara Lipinski, and Johnny Weir used silence effectively during Alysa Liu's Olympic gold-winning figure skating performance.
Providence led U.S. markets in viewership ratings for Super Bowl LX, with a 51.2 rating, as the Patriots lost to the Seahawks.

title: Free MBTA bus program extended â€” for now
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Boston will extend fare-free service on MBTA routes 23, 28, and 29 through June using remaining federal funds.
Routes 23, 28, and 29 serve Mattapan, Dorchester, and Roxbury and are key to Boston's equitable reopening and recovery.
Mayor Wu is discussing the program's future with the MBTA; funding beyond June remains uncertain.

title: Snow totals: See how much snow your town got
author: Boston.com Staff
bullets: Franklin County reported the highest snowfall in Massachusetts with Leyden receiving 6.5 inches as of Saturday morning.
Essex County saw significant snowfall with Haverhill getting up to 5 inches by Saturday morning.
A more severe winter storm is expected from Sunday night to Monday, bringing blizzard conditions and potential power outages.

title: She’s running the 2026 Boston Marathon for the 2013 bombing victims
author: Annie Jonas
bullets: Marissa LaRosa, 30, from Canton, is running the 2026 Boston Marathon to honor the 2013 bombing victims.
LaRosa's inspiration includes the resilience of 2013 victims and her coworker Annie, who has run the marathon 24 times.
The 2026 marathon marks a personal achievement for LaRosa, combining physical and mental growth through the event.

title: NH man sentenced for using $1M in COVID relief funds to buy golf course
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Michael Kirouac sentenced to 15 months for wire fraud after misusing $1 million in COVID relief funds.
Kirouac used $600,000 of the Economic Injury Disaster Loans to buy the Angus Lea Golf Course.
He falsely certified using relief funds as working capital while buying a golf course and misleading authorities.

title: Man with 25-year record charged in high-end Boston shoplifting spree
author: Morgan Rousseau
bullets: Peter Cutelis, 40, charged with multiple larceny counts for thefts at Newbury Street and Prudential Center stores in Boston.
Cutelis also faces charges for possessing fentanyl, crack cocaine, and clonazepam after arrest in Boston Municipal Court.
Bail set at $2,500; held without bail on fugitive warrant; due back in court March 6 for probable cause hearing.

title: Red Sox will keep Roman Anthony in leadoff spot for 2026 season. What could rest of lineup look like?
author: Conor Roche
bullets: Roman Anthony will be the Red Sox leadoff hitter for the 2026 season, according to manager Alex Cora.
Anthony hit .336 with six home runs and a 1.003 OPS in the leadoff spot during the final stretch of 2025.
In addition to Anthony, offseason acquisition Willson Contreras will bat cleanup, maintaining lefty-righty lineup balance.

title: Margo Price talks AI, bro-country and meeting Joan Baez at the circus
author: Lauren Daley
bullets: Margo Price discusses her musical inspirations and an unexpected Massachusetts connection ahead of her Boston show at The Royale.
Her latest album, 'Hard Headed Woman,' is influenced by traditional country roots and was nominated for two Grammys.
Price recalls advice from Joan Baez and shares her stance on originality in country music amid mainstream trends.
